name: Wireless LAN
author: Arnd Hartmanns <a.hartmanns@utwente.nl>
description: A Modest PTA model of IEEE 802.11 Wireless LAN with the original timing parameters from the standard, based on the PRISM case study with reduced timing parameters [1]. It models two stations trying to send a single packet each. The maximum value of their backoff counters is `K´.

properties.name: P_1
properties.description: Verifies that eventually both stations have sent their packet correctly with probability 1.

properties.name: P_min
properties.description: The minimum probability that either station's backoff counter reaches `K´.

properties.name: P_max
properties.description: The maximum probability that either station's backoff counter reaches `K´.

properties.name: D_and
properties.description: The minimum probability of both stations correctly delivering their packets within a time bound.

properties.name: D_or
properties.description: The minimum probability of either station correctly delivering its packet within a time bound.

properties.name: D_1
properties.description: The minimum probability of station 1 correctly delivering its packet within a time bound.

properties.name: E_and
properties.description: The maximum expected time until both stations correctly deliver their packets.

properties.name: E_or
properties.description: The maximum expected time until either station correctly delivers its packet.

properties.name: E_1
properties.description: The maximum expected time until station 1 correctly delivers its packet.
